messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Hey, good evening.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: How you doin?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Good evening. Nothing much goin on here, you know...

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Well, nothing it's still better than something bad they say.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: So, how's business?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: As usual, but we've recently introduced some new drinks on the menu.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I hope this will attract more customers.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: By the way, It's been a while since you've been here, I'm glad to see you again.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Something happened?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: You bet.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: My son, Gareth, you know, he was fired from his job.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Shit happens, you will say, but I really cared about it.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: He has just been hired by the Army Energy Department, at the Third Battalion.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Isn't it the one that is dealing with the imbalances with the Dyson sphere?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Exactly.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: He felt important, for the first time in his life I think, but wrong calculations, I don't know much about that shit, and he was kicked out in no time.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Oh lord, for just one single mistake?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Yeah... Apparently the work policies are very strict to ensure the maximum grade of safety.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: I get it, if they made too many mistakes we'd blow up in a fraction of a second.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: But it wasn't the case, though...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: That's wild... How does he feel about it now?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Heh, he barely eats these days...

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: He's been lying on the bed for... Four days, now? I don't know.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Can't he appeal?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: No, it was excluded from the contract.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Work policies are getting crazier day after day, you know.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I'm so sorry. How 'bout you?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Well, I'm his father, of course I'm sad, but I'm also disappointed.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: He should've been more careful, God!

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: We've paid all those tuition and taxes for nothing...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Why would you say so?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: 'Cause he's still the same clod he's always been. I can't see where he gets it...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: You didn't just stumble coming in, did you?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: No, ok, I see where this is going. I'll stop you.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: I have always been meticulous and precise on work.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Come on! You either make it or you don't in this world, it's no more than a couple of chances.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: I don't want to be the father of a failure.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: You know what they end up doing...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: They end up working in cafes?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: That's a good one. No, of course.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: They end up working for pennies in the lower ranks of the Defense Army...

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: You know what that means?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Fighting with those creatures for all his life, if he somehow manages to survive.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I get your concerns, but I'm wondering, How are you dealing with him now?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: I told him I'm disappointed.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: He's a total delusion for me and Katherine.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: God, what will others say, what a shame...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: come on! What are you talking about, he made just one mistake!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: You will end up making him more depressed. Being that strict is useless...

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Strict, huh? I appreciate your concern, but... Don't get in the way.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Really. I know my son better than you do.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Instead of talking 'bout him, serve me some of those... New drinks? Am I right?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: I'd like something with lemon.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Okay... Lemme see... Oh, I think I've got something perfect for you.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, how was your drink?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: It's nice... Refreshing...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I know, I studied it a lot to get that taste...

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: I feel much calmer now... Thank you.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, what were we talking about? Your son, right?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Yeah, about him being fired at work.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, as you said, I shouldn't get in the way... But, again, why don't you try being less strict?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Hm...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: You were young too, and you made mistakes... And you still make them...

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Yeah... But, I mean...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: And being strict won't help his self-esteem.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Yeah, I know that...

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: ... Maybe you're right after all...

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: I will talk with my wife too.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Yeah, you should definitely define a strategy to deal with this situation.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Yeah... Thank you, I feel much better now.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Are you going home now?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Yeah, I think I'll talk to my son.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Bye!

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Bye, see you.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, how was your drink?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Not bad... Although I preferred something else, it's good.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, what were we talking about? Your son?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: No, please, let's not talk about this.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: You sure?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Yeah, I'll deal with this alone.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: I'll try to be less harsh, but if he doesn't find another job in one month, I'll kick him out.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: For real?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Yeah... That's the only way.

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Now I'll go home, see you.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Bye!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, how was your drink?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: I'm sorry, but I don't like this... It's... Just not my kind of drink...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Do you want something else?

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Nono! Thank you, I'm fine...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: And my son just texted me... That idiot...

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: I think I'll go...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Oh... Goodbye!

messages.speaker: Fred
messages.text: Bye.

messages.speaker: Customer
messages.text: Hi human

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Good evening and welcome to the Sunfall

messages.speaker: Customer
messages.text: Is this that Sunfall?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Well, I don't know which bar you're looking for

messages.speaker: Customer
messages.text: You don't know your place is that famous?

messages.speaker: Customer
messages.text: There are myths about your place in the cyberspace

messages.speaker: Customer
messages.text: People thinks it's a legend

messages.speaker: Customer
messages.text: I had no idea I would end up here today

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Yeah, I know but I don't like to brag

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Maybe this is the place you needed to be

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: How are things going?

messages.speaker: Customer
messages.text: Not great, some problems at work

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: What’s your job?

messages.speaker: Customer
messages.text: I'm a net diver

messages.speaker: Customer
messages.text: I'm a myth too, you know?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: May I know your name?

messages.speaker: Customer
messages.text: I use the name [Jingke]

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Oh, so you're not a legend

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: Yeah, not an easy role

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: You probably know something about it

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Now I'm curious to listen to some epic story

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: What are your problems about?

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: I can't say too much

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: The group asked high level secrecy

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: Let's say it's more illegal than usual

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: I was one of the founder of the group

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: It was meant to be a political hacker collective

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: But we had come across internal problems

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: Now I help only for special jobs

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So this new job it's important?

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: It could change everything

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: If we succede the biggest corporations will lose their main tecnologies

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: You have multiple targets?

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: It's a storic operation

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: We planned it in years

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: They knew it was coming

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: You don't seem the kind of android that worries about this kind of things

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I've heard you have already done the impossible

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: Well, the operation it's not easy

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: But the hacking in the cyberspace it's not what worries me

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: I’ve always tried to be ethic

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: Laws are not, nowadays

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: But my code was always to choose an ethical option

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: And now I have to break it

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: I would have to kill

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I'm curious

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: What do you feel when you experience an ethical dilemma?

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: I don't feel anything particularly.

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: But all my attention is focused on that

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: I can't really process more information

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Can you break it, though?

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: I thought we couldn’t, honestly

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: But the truth is no-one actually tried

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Are you willing to, though?

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: Since it’s for a good cause, yeah

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: I think it's easier for me to break it

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Maybe it's courage that you lack, isn't it?

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: Hah. Do you think so?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Well, you are having a human experience, I think

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So we can use human solution

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Well, let's get started by drinking something

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Do you have any preferences?

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: No, but I like watermelon.

scenes.description: I don't have preferences but I like watermelon.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Did you like your drink?

messages.speaker: X
messages.text: Yeah. I like this so much.

messages.speaker: X
messages.text: Happy to hear that

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, have you made a decision?

messages.speaker: X
messages.text: Not yet, but now I feel more confident

messages.speaker: X
messages.text: After talking to you, it has become easier for me to break the code I think

messages.speaker: X
messages.text: I don't feel much stress

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Nice, that’s what I hoped for

messages.speaker: X
messages.text: Now I think I’ll have to go

messages.speaker: X
messages.text: See you, human

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: See you!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Do you like your drink?

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: Soso, human.

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: But don't worry

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Have you made any decision?

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: No, not yet. I feel a bit confused now

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Oh, I'm sorry.

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: But I think I will. I just have to focus

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: That's good to hear

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: Now I'll go, thank you and goodbye

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Goodbye!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: How's your drink?

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: It's… not what I asked for

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Oh, I'm sorry!

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: I feel a bit confused now

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: About your code?

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: About anything.

messages.speaker: Jingke
messages.text: I have to go now. Goodbye!

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Hi!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Hey, what's up?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: I've so much tea to spill this time, Barman.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Really? Have a seat then.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: It's a quiet evening, so I'm all ears.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Try and take a guess?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Some girls again?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Am I that boring? Yeah, it's a girl. This time, too.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Do I know her?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Nah, I don't think so.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Her name is Ying Ying. She studies at the Nuclear Department with me.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: I'll show you a little hologram I have of her.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Hah, she's cute, this time.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: What do you mean this time? Leyla was cute too...

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Ok, she wasn't objectively beautiful... But she was still nice... Well...

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: By the way, no, this time she is cute.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Have you talked to her?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Yeah. We are classmates, we even studied together once or twice.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Nice.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Is she smart?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Yeah, but she's not very keen on quantum physics.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Isn't it your major?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Yeah. So I was thinking... Maybe I can offer to help her with some lessons...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Indeed, good idea.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: ... But I don't know.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Why?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: I don't know... What if she doesn't like me?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Why'd you say so?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Well, what do I have to offer?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Offer?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Yeah, apart from lessons I mean.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: She's cuter, smarter, richer...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: And?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Hum, nicer?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Haha. No, I mean, why do you care about that?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: What?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: She's so nice, isn't it something you should be happy about?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: But maybe she won't like me...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Well... Take your lessons, ask her out... And if she doesn't like you she will reject you.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Nothing more than this. It may happen, it may not, but your life won't end if so, I can assure you.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: I'm not sure...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Haha, what do you say?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Just kidding.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: But I don't have enough courage to do so.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Now, have something to drink first…

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: I'd like something with coke, if possible.

scenes.description: I'd like something with coke, if possible.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, did you enjoy your drink?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Yeah, it was so sweet, and I like sweet things.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Haha, like your girl?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Yeah, she's so sweet when she talks...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Isn't that programmed?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Well, it's well programmed at least.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, what are you going to do?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: You know what? I'll ask Ying Ying out.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Really?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Yeah, you helped me make up my mind.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Nothing. I think the drink might have helped too.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, let me know.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: I'll go now.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: See you!

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Bye!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, did you enjoy your drink?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Yeah... I mean, it's a bit sour but still.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Oh, I'm sorry.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: No no, it's fine.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: What about the girl we were talking about?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Yeah.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Will you ask her out?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: I don't know... Maybe? I guess...

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: I still have to find the courage.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: But your words helped, I guess.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: I'll go home now.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Goodbye!

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Bye bye.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: How was your drink?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: I'm sorry, but I don't like this.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: It's not your fault, I don't like the ingredients.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I'm sorry.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: No problem...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Talking about that girl, what are you going to do?

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Eh, I don't know... I don't feel too good now.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: I'll just wait, maybe.

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: I'll go home now.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Bye!

messages.speaker: Zhang
messages.text: Bye!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Good Evening!

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Hi... Is this the Sunset bar, right?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Yeah, we have been serving drinks since 2070.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Huh. That's nice.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: You don't look like you come from here, do you?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Nono, I come from outside the city.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: The poor districts, you know?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Wow, how long have you been here?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Three years.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, how do you feel here?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Is everything good? You look so sad.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: I like the people, the city, and the food.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Only the job is a problem for me.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Oh indeed, what do you do for a living?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: I work in glasshouses, near the Space port.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So you work in the agriculture sector.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Yeah, I grow plants for distribution.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So why did you say you don't like it?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: The salary is bad, and the working conditions are awful.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: They don't really care about us.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Well, workers from here are treated better, but for us... There's no respect.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: How much do they pay you?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: 500 yan. I have trouble even with groceries.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: What about your boss being cruel?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: We have no rights

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: We must work 10 hours, by contract.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: But our boss makes us work 16 hours, or even 18.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: That's horrible.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: We are constantly pushed to get upgrades with our implements.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: It's exhausting.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I'm so sorry for you.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: I want to come back home. But I just don't have the money necessary to move back there.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Would you be safe there? I've heard that the situation there is unstable.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Nono, now stable.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Economy there is good.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Sometimes better than here even.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: That's nice. So, how are you planning to get the money necessary to leave?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: I want to denounce my boss to the police...

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: I'd use the compensation amount to leave.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Nice idea, I support you.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Just... I don't have courage.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: I'm a bit scared.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Why?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: I'm scared that corrupt policemen will inform my boss.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: He would haunt me forever.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Maybe the best choice is not to directly go to the police.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I've a friend who works for an independent newspaper.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Maybe you can tell him, and make him publish an article.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: And then, you can go to the police.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: But now I live in the glasshouse dormitory, I don't even have anywhere else to go.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: That's not a problem. Upstairs, we have one room nobody uses.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: You can stay there for all the time you need, I promise.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Nothing can happen to you there.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Thank you.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: You don't have to be scared.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: You've all the right to denounce.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Police will help you.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Let me offer you a drink, I'm sure you will feel much better after.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Thank you so much, do you have something with strawberries?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Let me see.

scenes.description: Do you have something with strawberries?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Thank you so much, I loved it.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I'm happy that you did.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, what are you going to do?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: I think I'll call your friend and tell him my story.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: That's nice. By the way, feel free to move here as soon as you need.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Yeah, I'm going to the glasshouse and get something.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Ok, see you soon!

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Yeah, I'll be right back.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Thank you!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Did you like it?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: It's just… not what I'm used to…

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: But it's good.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So what are you going to do?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: I don't know yet… I'm a bit uncertain.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: It's ok, take your time to decide.

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Yeah, by the way, I have to go back to work now.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Of course, see you soon!

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Bye!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Do you like this?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: Mh, it's not what I asked for…

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I'm sorry.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So what are you going to do?

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: I don't know…

messages.speaker: Qu Yuan
messages.text: I'm sorry, I think I'll go now.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Oh, ok… See you!

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Good evening!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Hi, good evening.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: ... Everything alright, Sima?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Yeah, why?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Hah, nothing, Sima. You just look really tired.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: I am, indeed.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Is this your first time coming here?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: If not, I'm sorry, I've a goldfish memory.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Yeah, I've never been in this section of the city.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: What brings you down here, then, Sima?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Hah, why so many questions?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Is that an interview or something?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I'm sorry, Sima. I like to chat with my clients...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, what can I get you?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Mh, don't worry. I guess you really were right, I'm tired and uneasy...

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Would you like to chat about that, Sima?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Would you be able to help me work my problem out?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: As long as you order something, I'm at your disposal, Sima.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Hah, venting to a random barman is not something I expected to do, but why not?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: As you please, Sima.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Can you stop calling me Sir?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Sure.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: I can't really go into detail, and I would rather you not to ask too much.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: People cite me as an example of discretion.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Let's trust people, then.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Well, imagine you're a journalist, same job as your father, ok?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Newspaper or television?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Irrelevant. Let's say you are investigating a big scandal regarding a big corporation in our country.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Are you referring to something specifically?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Irrelevant. Let's say we're talking about national safety, ok?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Does it have to do with the question of nuclear pollution?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Did you forget what I told you five seconds ago?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: No. I'm sorry. Please, go on.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Thank you!

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Ok, let's say you've been investigating for years and years...

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: … and you've finally found the proof that links the corporation management to this big scandal.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I would be very happy, but you don't really look very happy.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Huh? Remember we're talking hypothetically. Nobody said it was me.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Got it.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: So, let's say you really wanted to publish your discoveries.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I would want that.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Yeah. But let's say that there is almost the certainty that that corporation is gonna hunt you forever and destroy your career, at least.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Ah, I understand.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Like they did with your father's. Then what would you do?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I would've been investigating for years, wouldn't I?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Indeed.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So that means I would be deeply interested in the issue, wouldn't I?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Absolutely.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: But would I really be in danger of my own life if I published the news?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: It's very likely.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Would I be unable to publish it anonymously?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: You would, but you know how these things work. They will get your name in no time.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Would I have many regrets if I don't publish it?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Unimaginably corrosive regrets.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Would the lives of many people benefit from my publication?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Incredibly.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Would I be able to secure myself by changing my identity, and willing to do so, afterwards?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: With all the risks of the case, yeah, I think you would.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Ok, I think I know everything I need to know.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: But, as I said, this is a cafe, you need to order something.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: What? You're that stingy? Seriously?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: I'll get anything, I'll let you choose for me.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Just one thing: use a lot of alcohol.

scenes.description: I'll get anything but use a lot of alcohol.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: How was your drink?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Perfect. I already feel a bit dizzy.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Hah. Do you have to drive?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: No, I'll take a flying bus.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, what are you going to do?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Hm?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I mean, with the publication.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Oh, I will publish it.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Talking with you made me realize it's the right thing.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I'm glad to hear this, but are you willing to take the risks?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Yeah, I'll talk in advance with a friend who is a policeman, maybe.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Now I'll go.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Thank you, bye!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Goodbye.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: How was your drink?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Perfect. I already feel a bit dizzy.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Yeah, I'll talk in advance with a friend who is a policeman, maybe.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Now I'll go.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Thank you, bye!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Goodbye.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: How was your drink?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: It's ok, although it's not what I expected.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Don't you like it?

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Can I make another one?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: No no, thanks.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: I'm ok.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: So, are you publishing that article?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: I don't know.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: I'm a bit scared.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: You know, I have little sons.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: If I didn't, I would have no problems.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Well, it's ok to think well before making a decision.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: I think so.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Now I'll go.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: Thank you, bye!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Bye!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Do you like the drink?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: That's not what I asked for…

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: I’m sorry.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Are you publishing the article, though?

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: I don't know…

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: I'm a bit scared…

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Oh.

messages.speaker: Sima
messages.text: I think I'll go now, bye!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Goodbye!

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: Well it's late.

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: The sun is rising

messages.speaker: Barman
messages.text: It's time to close.

messages.speaker: Barman
